pr_title: feat: clarify key or value in (de)serialization processing log messages

timeline.message: feat: add component to (de)serialization processing log messages

timeline.bodyText: We should have a unit test testing this. Can you add one please?
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

timeline.bodyText: We should have a unit test testing this. Can you add one please?
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

timeline.bodyText:
I know this is a cut & paste, but I've seen this remove(0) remove the actual cause of the error, e.g. I've seen cases where exception is a simple NullPointerException and the remove(0) has resulted in an empty cause list.
Personally, I'd remove the remove and inline this method.
Which would only leave getRecordComponent, which I'd also be tempted to remove, and just add appropriate "key" and "value" constants to ProcessingLogMessageSchema instead.
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

replies.bodyText: The first error message (the one being removed by this line) is already captured in the errorMessage field, which is why it's purposefully left out of the cause field. It sounds like you're advocating for duplication of the initial error message, so that the cause field is complete?
replies.author: vcrfxia

timeline.bodyText:
Probably worth adding a test that called configure with isKey=true, and ensure logged error has isKey=true.
Same for LoggingSerializerTest.
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

timeline.message: test: add hashcode and equals tests
test: add logging serde unit test for keys
